## SDQ vs SPPC

Harmonisation is a crucial process in psychological and social studies, enabling comparisons within and across different studies. A typical aspect of harmonisation involves comparing items in varied questionnaires, a process often found to be tedious and time-consuming. Hence, the need for Harmony - an advanced tool specially designed to simplify this process. Say, for instance, comparing items from the 'Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire' (SDQ) and the 'Self-Perception Profile for Children' (SPPC), both quintessential tools utilized in child psychology. Harmony, with its state-of-the-art methodology, can flawlessly carry out an SDQ vs SPPC analysis, presenting psychologists with valuable insights. Harmony unlocks the potential of natural language processing and generative AI models for harmonisation. Suppose psychologists need to perform an SDQ vs SPPC study to evaluate similarities or differences in these child-related assessments. Harmony's large language models compare the instruments, presenting a percentage match between each item in SDQ and SPPC. This digital tool equips researchers with the power to conduct more accurate and efficient comparisons, even in multiple languages. Thus, tapping into the SDQ vs SPPC comparison with Harmony becomes less arduous. If you are a psychologist or a researcher keen on breaking down the barriers of harmonisation, Harmony is the solution. With just a simple drag and drop of the PDF versions of the instruments into Harmony's web interface, you can begin your journey. An SDQ vs SPPC comparison can offer more profound insights into child behaviour and self-perception, contributing significantly to child psychology studies.

## Compare the items in SDQ and SPPC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and SPPC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SPPC into Harmony</a> - compare SPPC with other instruments
